content: pickle buddy introduction who doesn t love pickles this large pickle friend stands 2 tall and is perfect for cuddling slip stitches help to give it its curved shape and large safety eyes and pink cheeks give it that perfect kawaii face you ll be smiling as you make this fun new toy experiment with the number of row to create a short fat kirby cucumber or long and lean persian cucumber materials stitches 130 yards of blanket yarn 6 weight single_crochet = single_crochet 9 0 mm hook mc = magic_ring 18mm safety eyes increase = increase scrap white pink black yarn decrease = decrease stuffing sl = slipstitch disclaimer this is a free pattern so you re welcome to share it with friends family and fellow crafters please feel free to gift or sell creations made from this pattern please do not claim this pattern as your own alter and/or distribute feel free to email me with any questions at spikeymermaidco@gmail com happy crafting body round 1 make 8 single_crochet in a mc 8 round 2 increase 16 round 3 1 x single_crochet increase x 8 24 round 4 single_crochet 24 round 5 2 x single_crochet increase x 8 32 round 6 single_crochet 32 round 7 3 x single_crochet increase x 8 40 round 8-19 single_crochet 12 rounds 40 round 20 slip_stitch in first 20 stitches single_crochet in remainder 40 round 21 single_crochet round 22 slip_stitch in first 20 stitches single_crochet in remainder 40 round 23-32 single_crochet 10 rounds 40 insert eyes between rounds 8 and 9 about 3 stitches apart using scrap yarn embroider eye highlights in white cheeks in pink and a mouth in black stuff to your desired stiffness round 33 3 x single_crochet decrease x 8 round 34 single_crochet round 35 2 x single_crochet decrease x 8 round 36 1 x single_crochet decrease x 8 round 37 decrease x 6 and fo weave in ends pickle bumps cut a long 2 piece of yarn using an embroidery needle pull the yarn through the bottom of the pickle leaving short tail and pop the needle out at a random spot skip one stitch and insert the needle into the body and back out the first stitch insert your crochet hook under the yarn so you don t pull the stitches too tight repeat 3 times for a total of 4 stitches pull out the crochet hook and you have a bump repeat as much and often as you d like to create bumps working from bottom to top and back to bottom when you re finished pull the yarn tail out of the starting hole in the bottom tie off and weave in ends alternate if you feel comfortable while crocheting the body randomly add bobble stitches throughout to create the bumps there are great bobble stitch tutorials on the web
